text: Hello, I downloaded data from reanalysis using Julia, and now have it as a .grib file on my computer. What is the easiest way to actually access the data now?

elements.text: Hello, I downloaded data from reanalysis using Julia, and now have it as a .grib file on my computer. What is the easiest way to actually access the data now?

text: There's the GRIB.jl package. You can add it with `]add GRIB` at the Julia prompt. The function to open a file is `GribFile`, and it behaves like an iterator. If you've used pygrib, the design is similar.

text: If you download them as `.nc`, you can use ClimateBase.jl to both read the data into memory, and also analyze them as dimensional data.

elements.text: , you can use ClimateBase.jl to both read the data into memory, and also analyze them as dimensional data.

text: I use it all the time with ERA5 data.

elements.text: I use it all the time with ERA5 data.
